identity.mission: Create a 'Cyber-Swiss' Control Room interface that merges high-precision utility with cinematic depth.
principles: Fusion: Swiss Grid precision + Cyberpunk atmosphere
Density: High data density, no wasted pixels
Contrast: Luminous data against void backgrounds

heading.usage: Page titles, widget headers, modal titles. Use tight tracking.

mono.usage: IDs, dates, currency, status codes, tabular data.

rules: Labels must be uppercase, text-xs, tracking-widest (0.1em), and text-muted-foreground.
Tabular numbers (font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums) are MANDATORY for all data tables.

structure: Main Content: Fluid width, max-w-[1600px] centered.
Dashboard Grid: grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3 lg:grid-cols-4 auto-rows-min.

Card.effect: Add a 'Tracing Beam' hover effect using a moving gradient border.

Table.style: Dense layout. Header: uppercase, text-xs, text-muted-foreground. Row hover: bg-white/5.

visual_enhancers.noise: Add a subtle SVG noise overlay at 2% opacity to the main background to kill the 'digital flatness'.

login_background.alt: Abstract dark geometric structure with glowing green lines
login_background.usage: Full screen background for Login page with overlay-black/80

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. THEME: Update 'tailwind.config.js' and 'index.css' with the provided color palette. FORCE DARK MODE.
3. LAYOUT: Create a 'DashboardLayout' component with the glassmorphism sidebar.
4. COMPONENTS: Customize Shadcn components. Do not use default rounded-lg, switch to rounded-sm or rounded-md.
5. DATA: Mock the service data. Ensure dates are close to expiry to demonstrate the status logic.
6. CRITICAL: Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid'.
7. CRITICAL: Do not use gradients for backgrounds, use solid dark colors + noise texture.
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI Slop': No generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry.
Spacing: Use p-8 or p-12 for main containers.
Micro-interactions: Every button must have a hover state (transform/color change).
Accessibility: Ensure text contrast > 4.5:1. Use 'sonner' for toasts.
